name: Dostart, Steven P.
title: President and Founder
ngos: Trustee, Menlo School; Chair, Civic Center Advisory Committee (Town of Atherton); Member, Stanford Real Estate Counsel; Member, Policy Advisory Board for Fisher Center for Real Estate & Urban Economics; Member, Grand Boulevard Initiative; Past President, NAIOP Silicon Valley; former board member, Reading Partners; former member, Leadership Council of New Schools Venture Fund
notes: Harvard College graduate (Magna Cum Laude); Arjay Miller Scholar, Stanford Graduate School of Business MBA; former Goldman Sachs investment banking; former partner Mozart Development Company; former Trammell Crow Company and Centre City Development Corporation

name: Ely, George W. Jr.
notes: Son of George Whittlesey Ely (pharmaceutical sales executive, Parke Davis & Company); family based in Davis, CA

name: Flax, Robert J.
employer: Law Offices of Robert J. Flax
title: Attorney (Inactive)
notes: California State Bar #65802; admitted 1975, UC Hastings College of the Law; voluntarily went inactive January 1, 2020; last listed address Menlo Park, CA

name: Foster, T. Jack III
title: Principal / Executive (third generation)
notes: Third-generation member of Foster family real estate dynasty; grandson of T. Jack Foster Sr. who founded Foster City, CA; by 1987 ran company's development arm alongside cousins Mark and Todd; Foster Enterprises based in Hillsborough, CA; manages nearly 250,000 sq ft of office/R&D space in San Francisco Bay Area and owns 6,500+ acres in California

name: Gallisa, Daniel
title: Financial Advisor, CFP (Certified Financial Planner)
notes: Harvard College graduate; joined Morgan Stanley in 2010; member of The Kremer Morthel Gallisa Group; born in Puerto Rico, grew up in Connecticut, based in San Francisco for ~25 years; formerly at Dolby Laboratories and advertising agencies

name: Gavenman, Samuel Charles
title: Brand Manager
notes: Based in San Francisco Bay Area; BA in Vocal Music Performance, Rice University (2013-2017)

name: Hagerman, David H.
title: President
notes: Also associated with Hagerman Enterprises, San Francisco; listed as key principal in San Francisco retail trade sector

name: Halse, Ehren K.
title: Partner, Special Matters/Government Investigations Practice Group
notes: Based in San Francisco; California State Bar #275354; specializes in FCPA, anti-corruption, FinTech/cryptocurrency regulation, sanctions, cybersecurity; extensive pro bono representation of disabled Iraq and Afghanistan veterans; named to Daily Journal 2025 Top White-Collar Lawyers list

name: Hanson, Paul Jr.
title: Associate Attorney
notes: Practices maritime law including Jones Act and Longshore and Harbor Workers' Compensation Act claims; joined firm 2024; BA Political Science/International Relations, UC Santa Barbara (2015); JD George Washington University Law School (2021); Eagle Scout

name: Hargrave, Alexander W.
title: Principal
notes: Based in Larkspur, CA; over 30 years financial services experience, 25 years in corporate retirement plans; formerly Partner and EVP at Nollenberger Capital Partners; BA Education, University of Wisconsin; Series 65 registration with Global Retirement Partners

name: Haskins, Scott M.
title: Principal / Founder
ngos: Board member, San Francisco Architectural Heritage; member, ULI; member, SPUR; member, BOMA
notes: Native San Franciscan; 25+ years commercial real estate experience; over $1 billion in projects; ~4 million sq ft and 750+ residential units; BS Finance/Math, San Diego State University; MS Real Estate, University of Wisconsin-Madison

name: Heywood, Robert G.
employer: Law Offices of Robert G. Heywood
title: Mediator / Arbitrator / Attorney
notes: California State Bar #66185; based in Oakland, CA; Stanford University undergraduate, UC Berkeley, Santa Clara University Law School (law review editor); practices mediation, arbitration, special master and discovery referee; has taught at Stanford Law, UC Hastings, USF Law School, Santa Clara University; mediation training at Harvard Law School; began practicing 1975

name: Hodges, Frederick Mansfield
title: Pianist / Historian
notes: California native; specializes in ragtime era piano music; classically trained; BA UC Berkeley; DPhil (doctorate in history) from Oxford University (2001); performed at San Francisco establishments including L'Etoile (Huntington Hotel), Masons (Fairmont Hotel), and Ritz Carlton; formerly pianist and singer with Royal Society Jazz Orchestra

name: Huffines, Steven Conway
title: Senior Managing Director, Transactions, Finance & Governance
notes: Based in San Francisco; 25+ years in financial advisory services specializing in alternative investment valuation; joined Ankura in 2018 when firm acquired C3 Consulting (where he was principal); previously headed alternative investment valuation practice at Navigant; formerly senior manager at BearingPoint; BS Management, Northwestern University (1983); MBA Finance and Accounting, Columbia Business School (1985)

name: Hughes, Francis J. Jr.
title: President
notes: Chairman of the Board at CPS Technologies Corporation (CPSH) since June 2018; independent director since 1993; formerly Boston Consulting Group (5 years); SB and MS from MIT; MBA Harvard Business School; based in Norton, Massachusetts area (not California)

name: Irving, Bradley
title: Founder / Orthodontist, DDS
notes: Based in Oakland, CA; BA Physiology, UC Berkeley; DDS and Orthodontic Degree, UCSF (1987 and 1989); clinical instructor at UCSF Dental School; member American Association of Orthodontists; formerly accomplished violinist; baritone singer with San Francisco Symphony Chorus

name: Janson, Jacques J.
title: Head of Retail, Americas
ngos: Board of Trustees, Seven Hills School (Walnut Creek, CA)
notes: 25+ years in retail industry; 20+ years in senior leadership; formerly SVP Stores, Ross Inc.; formerly director roles at ShopKo and Gap Inc.; leads stores, operations, construction, and real estate for VF Corporation Americas

name: Johnstone, Homer
title: Distinguished Adjunct Professor
notes: Retired U.S. Army Brigadier General; West Point Class of 1957; BS General Engineering (West Point); MS Civil Engineering (UC Berkeley); Master of Military Arts and Sciences (U.S. Army C&GS College); DBA Technology Management (George Washington University); Legion of Merit (Vietnam, 1970-71) as CO 8th Engineer Battalion, 1st Cavalry Division; Legion of Merit (Korea, 1978-79); Army Distinguished Service Medal (San Francisco Division Engineer, 1980-83); commanded Corps of Engineers projects in 7 southwestern states; designed/built Spaceport at Vandenberg AFB; founded engineering/construction firm in North Bay specializing in environmental cleanup (built to $18M annual revenue, then sold); teaches at Ageno School of Business, GGU

name: Karren, Charles Parker
employer: Terra de Promissio / Land of Promise Wine
title: Co-Founder / Owner
ngos: Sonoma County Wine Grape Foundation (board member since 2014); formerly elected board member Sonoma County Wine Grape Commission (2008-2014); adviser, FIVS (International Federation of Wines and Spirits, Paris)
notes: Born in London, England; 8th generation Texan; raised in Houston; BA UC Berkeley (1990); founded Terra de Promissio vineyard in 1999 (Sonoma Coast AVA, near Petaluma, CA; 50 acres of Pinot Noir); founded Land of Promise Wine in 2013; expanded to Fredericksburg, Texas in 2021

name: Kelley, John Armstrong
title: Partner
notes: California State Bar #194073; admitted 1998; based in San Francisco; practices business/commercial disputes, consumer fraud, intellectual property, personal injury, employment; formerly at Brown & Bain (Palo Alto), Morrison & Foerster, and Sequoia Law Group; address 90 New Montgomery St, 9th Floor, San Francisco

name: Krimm, David R.
employer: Global Retirement Partners LLC / Hargrave Fiduciary Advisors
title: CFP, Financial Advisor
ngos: Board President, Mission Asset Fund (nonprofit microfinance); formerly Chair, Opportunity Fund Board (San Jose); listed in Horizons Foundation Directory of Professional Advisors for LGBTQ Community
notes: Based in San Francisco/San Rafael, CA; BA Brown University; MBA Yale School of Management; Certificate in Personal Financial Planning, UC Berkeley; formerly senior management at Silicon Valley Bank, JPMorgan, Hambrecht & Quist, Intuit, Charles Schwab & Co.; led financial product development and fundraising/marketing at San Francisco Foundation; David Krimm Memorial Foundation exists

name: Kruse, Christopher S.
title: Executive Vice President, Commercial & Shareholder Advisor
notes: Based in Burlingame, CA; formerly at YesVideo (Advisor/Director), Epiq, and Adroit Ways; MS Financial Engineering, UC Berkeley; attended Georgetown University

name: Lambertson, David Stoddard
notes: Based in Hillsborough, CA (San Mateo County); likely related to David Floyd Lambertson (former U.S. Ambassador to Thailand, 1991-1995, retired Foreign Service Officer)

name: Larwood, David J.
title: CEO and Founder
notes: Serial entrepreneur and attorney; BS Pharmaceutical Chemistry (UCSF, PhD candidate); JD UC Berkeley School of Law; MBA; co-invented PEG liposomes drug delivery system (used in Doxil); formerly Senior Patent Counsel at Apple Computer; took Verisity Ltd. public as General Counsel (2001, acquired 2005); VP/primary attorney at FormFactor (public since 2003); Valley Fever Solutions secured $7M in NIH funding for antifungal NikZ; based in Woodside, CA

name: Leep, Thomas E.
notes: Based in Menlo Park, CA; associated with Rothenberg Ventures (finance executive with expertise in startups)

name: Leylegian, George A.
title: President, CEO, Chairman, and Treasurer
ngos: Active board member of several Armenian religious institutions; member, Association for Investment Management and Research; member, Security Analysts Society of San Francisco
notes: Based in Atherton/South San Francisco, CA (601 Gateway Blvd, South San Francisco); SEC-registered investment adviser since 2001; manages ~$22M for 16 clients; BA Claremont McKenna College; MA University of San Francisco; additional masters in Business Administration, Law (contracts), and Ministry (University of San Francisco Jesuit); DMin (Ministry) from University of San Francisco; doctorate in theology; Archdeacon at Saint Gregory the Illuminator Armenian Apostolic Church, San Francisco; scholar in Armenian Church Liturgy
